Reviews.Title: “We would go there again”
Reviews.Author: trvlbug45
Reviews.Content: Great location. clean. Very nice and helpful front desk. Free WiFi in rooms is a blessing for google maps etc. Buying your own food saves a bundle- there's a Monoprix a couple of minutes away with great deli food (rabbit, beef tongue, escargot,-also chicken etc) and cheap groceries and wine. Lots of room. Having the 1 bedroom gives you a chance to spread out and get away from kids. Small dishwasher in kitchenette. Free coffee/espresso/chocolate etc in lobby.Tons of eateries around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “location,location!”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl_8
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights in a studio apartment. Simply ideal for exploring Paris on foot. Notre dame, Lourve, musee de orsay, opera, and much more all within walking distance. St germain itself is simply charrming. It depend on your tastes but i preferred St germain to the Opera area. Very cool and funky without being prententious. Has a great vibe with all the winding streets and cafes and charming shops. Not loads of tour buses ect. For booklovers..shakesphere & co bookstore is just up the road and just delightful. The apartments are very well designed and equipped with comfortable space and windows that open (great as i found the heating can get quite stuffy in paris). Very comfortable bed and pillows that were like clouds. Having Kitchenette really great for bringing home some of those french delights. There is a supermarket a very short 5 minutes walk away which has everything you would need as well as many independent food shops selling many treats, sweet and savoury. The hotel offers breakfast at 15 euros (continental). However with the many cafes and supermarket you may want to consider your options. Reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. Special mention. There is a spa around the corner on Rue Daulphine called 'Ban Thai spa'. Simply magical massage treatments. I visited twice. It is at the higher end $ wise but well worth it and needed after all the walking you will do in sensational paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 3 generations staying in 3 separate rooms in one apartment (baby in cot in bathroom as separate loo and sink in kitche”
Reviews.Author: Brusselsprout
Reviews.Content: Very clean, central, supermarket and vibrant rue de buci three mins away. Apartment spacious and fully furnished small but perfectly kitted out kitchen behind sliding door. Very very quiet. Perfectly suited our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: martyb-tripster
Reviews.Content: An attractive lobby and friendly staff greeted us at the Citadines. The location couldn't be more ideal. On the Seine just a few blocks from the Louvre and Notre Dame, the hotel is a most convenient home base for meandering treks through the 6th and 5th arrondissements as well as Le Marais on the right bank. An added money-saving advantage: you can take the RER train from the airport (CDG) directly to the St. Germian metro stop, a short 2 block walk to the hotel. The Citadines is an apartment hotel, and our room on the 6th floor did have a very functional small kitchenette. The room was clean and the bathroom was modern with a European setup which means some shower water will find its way onto the bathroom floor. An electric towel warmer was a nice unexpected amenity. We can't say the Citadines evokes old world charm or the sophistcation of some of the newer hotels. But for the traveler on a budget, if you can book a room at a reasonable rate, the Ciatdines is a good choice. The location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: tastydee
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a family of 4, and the suite at Citadines was just right. Also, I wanted a gym and "american" style showers. Citadines Prestige Saint-Germain-des-Pres is in a fabulous location, and the hotel is modern, clean and well-maintained. The staff is friendly, professional and helpful. The gym is adequate, not huge, but has new equipment and is clean. The hotel room was newly renovated, with all new appliances and furniture, and, while small, was very comfortable for us. The master bed is very firm (which we like) and extremely comfortable. We were facing a courtyard, and while we didn't expect a view, it was peacefully quiet. The staff responded quickly to requests for maintenance and supplies. The wifi worked very well, and the kids loved the expresso/coffee/hot chocolate machine. We walked to many great places from the hotel, including Musee D'Orsay, Saint Michel, Notre Dame, Luxemborg Gardens and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: snurby1
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located hotel within waking distance from Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, pont neuf, plus loads of other attractions. Very good if travelling with kids as you can book apartment style rooms with separate bedroom and large lounge that converts to bedroom. Well stocked small kitchen with fridge. Staff were extremely helpful. We arrived very early (check-in was supposed to be 2pm) and staff found us a room anyway. Also one of the staff on reception helped me book tickets for Eiffel tower on the Internet (I am rubbish with computers & was having difficulty with the Internet form). Yes we loved the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best location and good value”
Reviews.Author: rbaileyhughes
Reviews.Content: My room was the best I've found for the price in Paris so far. Good price range. Clean and not as small as most Paris rooms. There are kitchen facilities and a supermarket nearby. The staff were helpful and there is a complimentary coffee bar in the foyer, which came in very handy after many hours of walking. The Location is the real selling point. Opposite the Ile de la Cite and next to Pont Neuf. Couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Paris delight”
Reviews.Author: o12
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Paris in Oct 11, 1 bedroom apartment, great location and great apartment, travelled with 21 yr son and the sofa bed in the lounge was more than enough for him to have a good nights sleep. Great shops and cafes nearby which was a good thing as we had a kitchenette with all utensils so we could cook some of our own meals. Front desk staff very helpful. Metro, Trains and bus all a short walk away and great view of the river. Would stay again. Very small lift but this is the norm for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: EllyMPerth
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We have an 8yo and a 6yo, and the configuration with the kids in the bedroom and my husband and I on the very comfortable sofa bed in the living room worked well. Reception were helpful and gave us a great little street map of the local area. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had pretty extensive choice including make your own fresh waffles! Fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for both business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PenguinoYork
Reviews.Content: Ideally located good location. Wide variety of restaurants on the doorstep . Minutes from rer and metro at St Michel linking Paris and outer areas. Rooms good size comfortable bed and wifi. Entrance and exit to car park is extremely tight. Large car and you will have problems.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient Location, Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nina p
Reviews.Content: Being right off the Pont Neuf, it is a very central and convenient hotel to stay in while in Paris. Everything was very clean, and having the kitchen made it nice to store snacks (cheese, wine, etc...) during our stay. The only complaint was they do not actually clean the room while you are there, except make the bed and place new towels. Since we were there 10 days, I would have liked them to change the sheets at least once during our stay. Also, their breakfast was rather expensive 14 euros for what it was, so we ate out for breakfast instead of dining with the hotel (which is fine because there is no shortage of restaurants to choose from!) I would absolutely RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone staying in Paris, purely based on the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: peter h
Reviews.Content: The only criticism we had happened on arrival.We had just arrived from Australia,and tried to check in at 8,but there were no rooms and we were told come back at two....fair enough.Had a lovely lunch,this was our third trip to Paris and we knew the area.Came back at two to be told your room is ready,then find it had been given to another couple who had just arrived.After some candid negotiation, we were offered another room.We arrived at our Room to find it had a sofa bed, when we had specifically asked for a double bed, 6 months previously.Back to reception to be told we had not requested a double bed,at which time we said forget it and went back to room....at that stage we would have slept on a potatoe sack.The sofa bed was reasonable,but I would have preferred a double,we were there for 9 nights. That aside ,we found the staff very helpful and freindly. The room was great(although the sofa bed was a niggle)and fully self contained,although we hardly used the kitchen facilities....hey its Paris!!!!!!Overall a very well appointed unit. There are Laundry facilities available in the basement,which is handy when travelling. There is free tea and coffee at reception,although we preferred the real thing at the hundreds of cafes in a short walking distance.They offer a buffet breakfast which looked average and I suggest you find a cafe outside.It is always a giggle to see how the waiter is going to play the game at the restaurants!!! Great location, close to everything, good rooms,good service and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice appart hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: lthg
Reviews.Content: Location is great. We can walk to lot of main sites like Louvre, notre dame de paris, Opera...There are lot of nice restaurant in this area...We just love this location. The hotel manager Mr Trinh is a very kind and nice gentleman. If you need anything, better to go ask him coz he will try his best to help you. Other staff at the reception counter are just ok. Our room is in 7F, viewing la seine, le louvre et notre dame from our window. Sunrise in paris from this angle is a inoubliable moment. We love this place and will go back next time

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav20
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay. Very warm welcome and helpful front desk person. The room was very nice by Parisian standards, everything felt very new. Free coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. The location in set on the bank of the river within a stones throw of the beautiful streets and restaurants of St. Germain. Just across the bridge is the Cite and Notre Dame. Bike rental machines are just around the corner from the hotel. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: KazNsw
Reviews.Content: We were 4 girls aged in our 50'2 and 20's and both age groups loved it here. i have stayed in Paris 4 times before and this was by far the best I have stayed in. We had a quad share room with kitchenette (which we didn't use - my God why would when you have sooooo many amazingly good restauarnats around the corner) The rooms was very clean, large and modern. The lobby area was large and also pristine. The location is fantastic - walk everywhere from here. It is hard to leave the neighbourhood though because of all the great restaurants and just the general feel to the place. Brilliant - will definitely go back. I am a travel consultant and I would definitely be sending all my clients here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vacancestoujour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice within a space of a month. The premier one bedroom apartment was much bigger than expected and very spacious. The premier studio was also of a generous size for Parisien standards. Both apartments fell below par of their online photos on the Citadines website, and the hall ways were a little dated. However on an overall basis, the apartments were sufficient for our requirements. The complimentary coffee/tea in the lobby was a bonus after a long day of sight seeing and the vending machines came in handy. Loved the location which was convenient for sightseeing on the left and right bank. Very handy to the metro Pont Neuf, St Michel and the RER. Wifi was super efficient and complimentary. Trinh at front desk was very pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for tourists”
Reviews.Author: nmitchell02
Reviews.Content: This was a great location to stay for tourists. Very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option!”
Reviews.Author: Bess_Marvin_NYC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Citadines Saint-Germain-des-Pres in October 2011. Everything about it was positive: (1) location is perfect, (2) very functional mini apartment, (3) loved having a kitchen for meals 'at home', and (4) service was very helpful, timely, and attentive. We will definitely return to Citadines Saint-Germain-des-Pres, the only reason we would not come back here is if we decided to get a non-hotel-service apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel marred by poor Internet connection and customer service”
Reviews.Author: pvtryan25
Reviews.Content: The French are not known to be the most hospitable of peoples towards foreigners, especially if you don't speak their language. This extends to most customer service staff, even in most hotels and restaurants. On the day of check-in, a counter staff by the name of Alejando greeted me with a deadpan expression and made me wait for almost 30 min (I was the only person at the counter), while entertaining queries over the phone. Why he chose to engage someone making a phone query about a prospective room reservation instead of engaging me, a guest who just arrived with 2 big bags and a confirmed pre-paid reservation, escaped me. I figured I must have arrived too early to check-in (around 11 am). Also, when I asked specific questions about the Internet (I needed it for work purposes), I was replied with a curt "I will explain everything to you at the end." The internet connection, which was part of the room package, was a major pain. My roommate went down late one night to complain about the poor connection and was met with "I am not a technician" reply. The next day, we discovered that there IS a resident technical specifically for the Internet, but after multiple phone calls and instructions to re-configure our laptops, the problem still wasn't solved. In the end, we got free and faster Internet speeds at McDonald's at Orly Airport when we were leaving Paris. That said, the hotel is in a good location to explore the rest of Paris. It is a RER train-ride away from Effel Tower, and is connected by metro to major hubs such as Paris Nord station and Chatelet. Walking to the metro station, though, takes about 10-15 min, but the scenery along the way along the Seine makes up for it. There is also free coffee, tea and cocoa for guests in the hotel lobby. Given a choice again though, I would have booked the Citadines across the Seine which is more connected to major metro lines. The hotel should consider employing staff who have more passion and pride in their work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Paris, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FeeJaySydney
Reviews.Content: We booked the Citidines Saint-Germain-des-Pres on the recommendation of our travel agent and also based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed at all. It is a very central and convenient location for exploring Paris whether you are happy to walk (as we did) or want to use public transport. We spent 5 nights in a one bedroom apartment which had everything we needed and was very comfortable and quiet. The beds were great and the bathroom was fine, if a bit small. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful whatever we asked or needed was no trouble. There are a large number of restaurants within a 5 minute walk and a supermarket about the same. We were able to purchase supplies for breakfast and lunches and ate out at night. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris and we will stay there again if we are lucky enough to go back to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have got the formula right for a great midrange Paris tourist hotel. It's in a great location. I was here with my family for one week and can highly recommended it. I normally stay around the Arch Triumph area but really enjoyed St. Germains. It was a much better location and all ares of Paris were easily accessed from here via the metro. The stayed in the one bedroom. It was huge by Paris standards!!!!!. Best of all it was on a higher level and looked over the Seine. It was the picture perfect location for Paris. The room was clean & modern, had an iron and board, AC was OK, WiFi worked well, plenty of hanging space, and we enjoyed a comfortable night sleep every night. The bathroom was big, but the shower was a bit average (this may have just been our room). The service provided by the front desk was better than most 5 star hotels. In particular, Jack and his manager were terrific in helping us when we checked in. In addition to this, the hotel had a guest self service laundry. For a family of 4 in paris for a week (...in the middle of a 5 week trip), it was a huge bonus. This hotel provides a high level of accommodation and service at a great price. I can highly recommend this hotel and will be back when I'm in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lurch0001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights. Our room was towards the rear of the hotel and didn't have much in the way of views but the upside was that it was very quiet. Our room had a small kitchen which I used to cook basic breakfasts (eggs and toast). The bathroom was well laid out, clean and functional, We did find that the cleaning staff would sometimes want to service the room late in the day (~5pm) which was inconvenient if we wanted to use the room after exploring Paris for the day. We found that you really need to use the "Do Not Disturb" sign otherwise they give very little notice before entering the room. The location of the hotel is excellent, with plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby, just a short walk from Pont Neuf and close to a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Donna F
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff excellent room definately would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: jgcc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Citadines Saint Germain des PrÃ¨s and the problem is that one cannot choose the position of the room during online reservation. It was our second time at the hotel this year, we had reserved an "one bedroom Premier appartment", for 8 nights in September at an average daily price of 320 Euros. The appartment had a small lateral view of the Seine, but was very noisy due to its placement near the main street and extremely poor sound insulation. At 5:30 we are awaken by the traffic on the Quai des Grands Augustins and at 6:30 started the music of the garbage trucks. The living room was alright, free internet, basic Citadines brand furniture with plenty of drawers and storage space for 2 people ( though not for 4). Bedroom was small, and in order to make up the bed (appart-hotel !) one has to jump over it, or to squeeze between bed and wall (photo). Bath towels are now changed everyday and thorough cleaning is done every three days. There is a small breakfast room in front of the reception ( 13 Euros ), and there is also complimentary coffee, tea and chocolate at the machines, and that is really nice in an appart-hotel. Checking-in requires patience, and as another reviewer remarked, I had to use the Amex card, since their machine didnÂ´t recognize my Visa with chip. The positive points of Citadines Saint Germain des PrÃ¨s are its excellent location and practicality and it is a good choice if one is not much concerned about comfort and style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna G
Reviews.Content: Excellent tourist hotel Verily the French Quarter, an interesting area, the hotel is almost at the bridge Pont Neuf, on the waterfront Senna. Breakfast is taken in boulangerite near the Hotel, within walking distance of the famous French cafÃ© Le Procope and CafÃ© de Flore. The hotel looks like a small apartment has everything you need, clean, quiet, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LuckyTravellers9
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and after much research on Trip Advisor we booked the Citadines St Germain. We were extremely happy with our choice, as we were staying for two weeks, we chose an apartment with a kitchen and laundry facilities. Upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly staff that all spoke english. We had booked a studio apartement and was upgraded to a Deluxe studio apartment which was very comfortable and roomy. Our room was towards the back of the hotel which looked onto a very quiet back street so we slept soundly. There are elevators, a small fitness room, free wii fii,free tea/coffee in foyer available 24/7, cool water, vending machine for snacks. We were able to walk to many of the attractions which we chose to do including the Eiffel Tower (approx 25 mins), Notre Dame (5 mins), The Louvre (10 mins), Arc de Triump (25 mins). We also booked some day tours to Versailles, Champagne and Mont St Michel. Some of the bus tours left from a location near the Louvre, or the small mini tours of up to 8 people would pick up and drop off at the hotel. We enjoyed every moment of our time in Paris and our hotel and staff contributed to the wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent experience, best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: estotipo
Reviews.Content: The apartments are pefect, clean, the location could not be better, staff friendly, loved the stay, and I have been in Paris for over 40 times.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Paris”
Reviews.Author: DianaWillTravel
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding. Our room was functional and compact. It is cosy for a family with small children. The kitchenette was handy for breakfast which wasn't included in our room rate. It is clean and well looked after, but not new. The staff are professional and everything runs smoothly. You can walk to many attractions, Notre Dame is a pretty awesome way to start.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful apartments in centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: traveller1431
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Citadines in April and enjoyed the friendly staff, location and was happy with the apartment. Unfortunately there was a power cut while I was there and I was moved to the Louvre Citadines. The hotel did this all with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative for a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cootje68
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Citadines St-Germain-des-Pres and can recommend it! It is close to the RER station, so very easy to get there from CDG airport, with RER B. The neighbourhood is great, student area with lots of art-stores, restaurants and bakeries. Louvre and Notre-Dame at walking distance. On arrival the check-in took quite some time. Although the receptionist was very friendly she tried to answer the phone, help her colleague and me at the same time. Same happened at check-out, so some issues at the front desk. I booked a Club-studio, had a terrific view over the river Seine, plenty of room, nice bathroom, good kitchen (with a dishwasher), fast internet. Ipod-dock was also very handy. Bed was very good, but the bed had strange legs that were sticking out 10cm, after hurting my feet twice I put some pillows against them. The room was not as clean as I like it, I found some hairs and nailclippings that were def. not mine.... The room is not cleaned every day, but I was called the second day if I needed clean towels or anything else, so no problem with that! Although some issues I can absolutely recommend this apartment, would return if I would go to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - plenty of room for family of 4 with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: SCfan88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2011 after returning from a cruise in Barcelona. We flew in and were greeted by very helpful and friendly staff. We booked an executive apartment which had a kitchen, large living room with two beds (one for our 15 yr old daughter and the other for our 12 yr old son), plus a separate bedroom with it's own tv for us. Location is nearly perfect. The neighborhood south of the hotel is filled with cafes, markets and style. The metro stop, St. Michel is a few minutes walk and the Notre Dame cathedral is literally across the street (and the river Seine). We rented Velib city bikes from one of two nearby bike racks. Bring an American Express card if your Visa isn't a Euro issued one with a security chip. America Visa credit cards don't have chips - so you need an Amex. Best way to see the city BY FAR. We spent hours riding each day, returning the bikes to a nearby rack (find the Velib iPhone app) wherever we were visiting. Hotel doesn't have a restaurant but does offer breakfast. I will be back with the family. Location, large rooms and nice but not overly fancy accommodations make it a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kewpey
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. The staff were friendly and my room was clean, quiet and quite spacious for being a studio. Large, comfortable bed and the bathroom had a tub with a nice sloped back that was perfect for soaking weary bones when too tired to stand for a shower. Large vanity, hair dryer and heated towel rack in the bathroom as well. Fully equipped kitchenette provides all the necessities for cooking your own meals. Also provided are iron/ironing board and free wifi in the lobby. The location couldn't be better. Located across the street from the Seine, many sights are within walking distance. Just minutes from Notre Dame, less than 10 minutes to The Louvre, 30 minutes to the Concorde and about the same to The Eiffel Tower and Champs-Elysees. Not to mention, restaurants, cafes, pubs, boutiques ..all within minutes walking distance from this hotel. Very close to the metro, monoprix and fruit market. I am a solo female traveller and felt very safe in this area and the hotel locks the doors after 9pm so only key-card holders can access the building. The staff did not even let phone calls go through to my room without asking my permission first. I would recommend staying here to anyone and I will without a doubt stay here again. My trip was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0302
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 15 year old daughter for 3 nights. We found it to be comfortable, clean, and the staff were pleasant. It is in a good location, as it's close to lots of cafe's, a supermarket and a market, and lots of boutiques. It is also just around the corner from the metro, which we found to be very useful. Although not luxurious, the room was adequate and everything was in working order, and we had no noise problems. The corridors were a bit shabby looking with noisy fire doors. Check out time was a problem, with only two small, slow lifts. We almost missed our train due to the delay with the lifts and check out. so I suggest you give yourself a good 20 minutes extra when leaving. Overall we found it to be a pleasant stay and we would be happy to stay there again if we were to ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Sven1300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a 1-bedroom, with a 5yr old, and my wife. Appartment was spacious and well equipped, all required infrastructure to be able to cook small meals for kids etc. Internet free and good. The hotel is centrally located with many opportunities for a walk in the neighbourhood. The street in front of the hotel is very busy, but our room was at the back side (=no view of Ilot SacrÃ© and Seine), but that was not really disappointing. Recommend for families and/or extended stay in Paris. Breakfast buffet was very disappointing, did not take it but had it in a bistro in the street, much more fun. Hotel was very busy with many tour groups arriving/departing at awkward times. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic.....”
Reviews.Author: kimmy_hk
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 (with a toddler) booked Citadines mainly for its location. But boy were we shocked with our room. Hotel lobby seemed promising but our room (1 bedroom 'suite' with kitchen) was... not nice at all. I've stayed at other hotels in Paris so am aware how small they can be but our room basically felt like a very basic motel of some sort. (broken wardrobe, very weak shower head in a tiny bathroom, really ancient and uncomfortable sofa, no dining table or chairs... list goes on) I still can't believe we were paying over USD500 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very spacious accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Familyoffive44
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (kids 14, 11 and 6) can report an excellent experience in Citadines Saint-Germain-des-PrÃ©s. Accommodation was spacious and spotlessly clean; air conditioning quiet and cool; kitchenette tiny but very well equipped. Desk staff unfailingly courteous and helpful. Location is unbeatable-do visit the Place Dauphine on the Ile de la CitÃ© (just off the Pont Neuf across from the hotel), it's a hidden gem! Only quibble: room could use a fold-out table for eating.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied punter!”
Reviews.Author: Rach_and_Rich
Reviews.Content: As we were in London we thought we would add on a Eurostar short break to Paris and chose this hotel because of the good reviews. It was everything we expected. Nice comfy bed, clean spacious room, good sized bath and bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. There were a few nice little extras like free internet, free 'proper' coffee, free chilled water and there were also nice toiletries in the room. The only thing missing was an oven (just two hobs and a microwave) but quite likely you would want to eat out anyway. The location is great- the Metro from Gard Du Nord takes less than 15 minutes followed by a 5/10 minute walk up the road. If you come into Gard Du Nord I thoroughly recommend using the metro rather than a taxi- the taxi will take much longer and cost 20 Euros (we were told) rather than 1.7 Euros (I think) per person on the Metro. Another Metro tip- at GDN don't queue up at the main entrance for tickets where everyone else is- there is a machine which takes coins or credit cards just before the barriers you pass through before going onto the platform and that is less crowded. Machines also have an option to read in your own language and tickets are easy to buy as they are a flat fare. The location is also great for shops and restaurants and I would have thought within 10 minutes walk from the hotel you have a restaurant for almost every cuisine on earth. Aside from French restaurants there were Indian, Thai, Japanese, Italian, Mexican, Lebanese etc etc. Plenty of cafes as well and although Paris is pretty expensive there were one or two streets that had cheaper meals. You are stil probably looking at a minimum of 20 Euros per person and probably a lot more at most places. The main supermarket is about 15 minutes walk but simple to find (the hotel has maps to show you where the main places are). Other than the supermarket and a few bakeries we didn't find much choice if you are self catering. We arrived on the Sunday which is the one day the supermarket closes early (generally I think it is open until 10 at night or similar) and we got rather hard done by for immediate provisions- milk, butter and cheese setting us back about 10 Euros which was double or more than we would have paid at the supermarket. So if buying for self catering it is more than worth making the effort to get to the supermarket rather than buying from the nearest little shop (of which we only found one anyway!). Best of all location wise is that it is perfect for the boat trips and main attractions. There are boat trips running from Pont Neuf which is very close to the hotel although they just tend to be one hour up the Seine and back. It's a bit more of a walk to a 'bateau bus' stop off point which is a hop on hop off boat that will (roughly) take you to the main places of interest in the city such as the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Notre Dame etc. The boat costs 14 Euros each for a day ticket. We did find it busy though and not the best views from the boat either with no commentary. So if it's just a trip on the river with a commentary you will be better off with the trips from Pont Neuf but if you want to get around the main attractions in the City with relative ease the bateau bus is best. The Louvre is within walking distance (maybe 20-30 minutes with the distraction of things on the way). All in all a comfortable environment and a great setting that made it a hassle free and enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cashmra
Reviews.Content: Great apartment hotel. Great service, Great location. Would definately stay here again. It is well appointed, modern, clean, free coffee all day. Room was spacious, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “not ideal, not bad”
Reviews.Author: ooooops
Reviews.Content: Go there of you are looking for a new, relatively small hotel, very good location, nice service, expensive but not outrageosly so. Do not go there if you are sensitive for unclean hotels, or want a good breakfast, or if being unable to use your computer in your room ruins your trip. Notwithstanding, I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Paris hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ShanFog
Reviews.Content: Myself & my Mum stayed here for a long weekend in early June. The hotel was immaculate and far fancier than we had expected, as we were really looking for a budget hotel in a good location but we definitely got a lot more! We stayed in one of the self catering apartment rooms (i.e. a kitchen area) which was lovely and clean and spacious. The hotel itself was very nice, with a big lobby which had computers you are able to use whenever you need. And whilst we didn't have breakfast in the hotel, there are coffee and drinks making facilities available in the lobby 24/7. The staff were very professional and welcoming on the occassions we spoke with them. The location was fabulous, right on the banks of the Seine pretty much opposite the Notre Dame cathedral and just along from St Michael metro station and a main shopping street. There's also an excellent restaurant district right by the metro station which was really fab and bustling in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families on many levels.”
Reviews.Author: SCMShopper
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (mom, dad, and two college-aged kids) spent 7 nights here and were pleasantly surprised beyond our expectations. First, the location is supreme...right on the left bank in wonderful St. Germain. This is a real neighborhood, with shops, cafes, and restaurants that does not at all feel as touristy as the Champs Elysees or Trocadero. We were on the 7th floor and the view was breathtaking, with the Seine below, Notre Dame on the right , and Montmartre in the distance to the left. Considering the location and overall quality of the services and amenities, this was an excellent value...especially when travelling with your family. We can't say enough about the front desk. Each member of the staff consistently went out of their way to help us with every aspect of our stay-- from restaurant recommendations and reservations, to shopping advice, metro directions, and arranging for excursions. This felt like a full-service hotel instead of apartments. We opted for maid service, which was excellent. The rooms in our apartment appeared to be recently renovated--all furnishings (including the bathroom and kitchenette) were in excellent condition and showed no visible signs of abuse or wear. The sole exception was the sofabed in the living room, which could have used a tiny bit of TLC. Each room was equipped with a flat screen TV and we had complimentary access to wi-fi for our iPad (as well as several desk tops and printers available for us in the lobby). There was ample closet space, and the heated drying rack in the bathroom came in quite handy. Breakfast was served in the lobby for a nominal charge, and a complimentary espresso machine was available, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Instead of breakfast in the hotel, however, we had a great time venturing out every morning to Carton, the neighborhood bakery, and opted for their goodies! The palmiers and pain au chocolat were exceptional. Also, a grocery store was a few minutes away and was a convenient way to stock our fridge with beverages, cheeses, and the fabulous local butter that we slathered all over the baguettes we bought at Carton. This was our third time in Paris, and our first time staying in St. Germain-des-Pres and we will never consider staying anywhere else. I would wholeheartedly recommend this Citadines.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation and great location”
Reviews.Author: Thekidsarepacked
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two young boys stayed in a 1-bedroom club on two occasions -- arriving in France on our way to Provence, and on our return to catch our flight home. We were very impressed by the size of the room -- a large bedroom with a king size bed and a large sitting area with a king size pull-out sofa bed with a mini kitchen and a desk. There was a hallway separating the two rooms with a large bathroom. A palace, particularly considering the size of most Paris hotel rooms. We were travelling with our 3 and 5 year old boys, so put them in the bedroom. The bedroom faces the courtyard and was virtual soundproof and has thick curtains so blocked the long lasting june sunshine. We slept on the pull-out, which has to be the comfiest pull-out we have every slept on. The sitting room faces in the Seine, which can be noisy. The sitting area has julliette balconies, so it was nice to open the windows and listen to the street noises over a glass of wine (once the kids were in bed). Not so great for sleeping, so I suggest you bring ear plugs. Also note that the bedroom does NOT have juliette balconies, so it was safe for the kids to sleep in. The hotel has air conditioning and free wifi. We brought our ipad which was great for the down times. Breakfast was more convenient than spectacular, but as we did not venture for anything else it served our purpose. Hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Notre Dame and Jardin du Luxembourg. Jardin du Luxembourg is a fantastic park to take the kids. Con - it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I found My Place in Paris for My Next Travels!”
Reviews.Author: Swanilda
Reviews.Content: Although my favorite "quartier" in Paris is always Montmartre, as this was a a trip with my students group, we should be more in the center, and I was very happy to find this place in such a good deal. It was perfect for our group with rooms for 4 and with kithchen. I chose the hotel for this reason and mainly for its perfect location just next to Notre Dame and Pont Neuf, but when I was there I found more than I was expecting. The reception staff was really very nice, kind and patient during our check in with our group of 35 people, most of them being children. Especially the one who helped us was always smiling. I found out later that not all of them are always so smiling:) The standard rooms for 4 were decent enough and very spacious for a Paris hotel room. My room (2302) with Seine view which was 35 euro more expensive per night than the standard room was excellent. I would say that you should pay this difference, it definitely worth it. The rooms were clean enough. The location perfect, the view perfect, the rooms decent and clean, and still affordable! What else would you want from a hotel in Paris? As I told, although my favourite place is Montmartre, I decided to stay here for these kind of group or business, or short time stays in my next travels in Paris. Although I always search for new options, I would stop searching in Paris, this is my place now on... I recommend it to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Very Good facilities, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: peepeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citadines St. Germaine for 5 days/4 nights in May 2011. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were very impressed with the rooms. It was new and well appointed, with complete kitchen and bathroom amenities. The location is excellent--- just across the Seine River, walking distance to the Louvre, D'Orsay and Notre Dame. There is self-service laundry facility at the basement, which I found very convenient. Coffee and tea service is free 24 hours at the lobby. The only downside I can think of is the price of the rooms---quite pricey at $300 ++ a nite for a 1 bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: KushLondon
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Citadines St Germain des Pres- Room- For the 3 of us we were allocated a 1 bedroom premier room on the 7th floor (top floor). Due to the shape of the roof, the room had sloping walls and in some areas particularly the bathroom it was very low so just take note as you may want to avoid staying on the 7th floor (the rooms on the other floors s are fine). The room was spacious but cozy at the same time and we felt comfortable staying there. One recommendation is that the hotel may want to upgrade the TV and provide some dish washing liquid as there was none in the kitchen. One convenient aspect is the laundry room in the basement. I thought we would get a washing machine in the room so was surprised it was in the basement. This was fine though as it was still useful to have this option. Laundry was 9 Euros. Location- Location was superb. 5- 10 mins walk to Notre Dame and right on the Seine. In addition, there were lots of restaurants and bars in the streets behind the hotel. Loved having Mariage Freres and Lauduree so close by! Staff- Sophie at reception was very helpful and provided some useful tips for getting around. Also, the ladies in the laundry room were helpful when trying to figure out how to use the machines! Breakfast- Breakfast was 13 Euros and although small it was packed with various items and everything was good. I loved the waffle machine which I had not seen at other hotels so that was a nice change. Overall we had a great stay, I would stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Paris! btw- I highly recommend the Foxity tour bus. It costs 14 Euros per person and takes you on a 1 hour 40 min tour of Paris. There is no hop on/hop off option which is nice if you just want to sit and see everything at one go. It was great value and the commentary was very good. Its pretty new apparently so not very well known. You can pick it up at 9 Place de la Madeleine. Do the bus & boat option (cruise on the river seine) as it is also excellent value! website: http://www.foxity.com/

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: joybAuckland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally sited for both dining and for attractions, and the rooms are spacious, quiet, and well serviced and maintained. The staff are friendly and helpful, and extra services, such as the laundry, are very useful.

Reviews.Title: “supreme location!”
Reviews.Author: ManthanUnadkat
Reviews.Content: though the rooms are a little small, but its nice and tidy. service is a lil poor but good breakfast.. but best part is the location, close to st. michaels and st. germain and notredame and louvre.. not very flashyand perfect if ur on a usiness trip.. id give it 3.5/5

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - did not love the sofa bed”
Reviews.Author: GBstravels
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for walking anywhere in Paris, there are plenty of restaurants and cafe's nearby, and the metro is extremely convenient. We were very disappointed to have a great sized studio room spoilt by the fold out sofa bed. It was not clear to us when booking that the bed would be a sofa, and it was not particularly comfortable. Had this been a double or king size bed this hotel would get 5 stars. Confirm what you get before booking to ensure you aren't disappointed, everything else about the hotel was of a very good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Spacious apartment.”
Reviews.Author: Polar_bear77
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in an apartment. Modern and clean. Well appointed with all we needed. We had views of the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame! Easy walk to the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and Louvre. Hardest part was deciding where to eat each night - so many choices and every choices a damn good feed! Staff organised a day trip to Disneyland for us too,

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Safe, Friendly & Clean”
Reviews.Author: C J Mitchell
Reviews.Content: This is a surprising value for money Hotel with an excellent location, Safe and Clean facility. The staff are very helpful and they provided expert assistance with taxis, attraction information and advice. The rooms were well laid out and the bathrooms were modern and functional. I liked the access to the microwave and fridge. We had a lovely view of the courtyard through large windows. The local supermarket was well stocked and walking through the streets to and from was a lot of fun too. Unfortunately, we could only stay here for a few days. The Metro is very close as is Notre Dame (my favourite location). The St Michel statue and fountain is worth a look too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, modern, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: parnassusgirl
Reviews.Content: Rented three studios for family group, all grown ups. Hotel is brilliantly placed for exploring Paris on foot - five minutes to Notre Dame and a Batobus stop, by public transport - even closer to St Michel metro and RER (good for connections to Eurostar and airports), while buses go past front door, and there's a rack of Paris' rental 'vel'libre' just behind the hotel, or even car - park under the hotel in secure, controlled garage with a lift to the room. Hotel is easy to find, has modern, well tended rooms, great little kitchenettes and charming staff. Just five minutes on foot to either Kayser's wonderful boulangerie (rue Ancienne Comedie) or Paul for breakfast bread and pastries. No, this is not a Hausmannian edifice, the rooms don't have shutters but when you've been pounding the pavements all day and want a lightning wash before hitting the restairants (place is surrounded by great restaurants) then the modern shower and generous bathroom menas you are in and out in the minimum of time. Or, if, you are overwhelmed with jet lag in the middle of the day, the bed is comfortable, the air conditioning nearly silent. There's a hifi, TV and wifi in each room for sleepless visitors and storage to get you things out of the way, plus easy chairs for lounging and a big desk / table, large enough for a meal for five or a serious day's work. Prices are good, it's easy to spend far more in Paris for a room that isn't as easy and relaxing. The car parking is cheaper than some of the city centre underground parks. Plus, you have the added advantage of the kitchenette. It's enough for a real meal, and more than enough to enable you to breakfast like a local, buy your own ground coffee, jam etc from the supermarket then take a short stroll every morning to pick up superlative bread, pastries (and not all bread is equal ) and eat in your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Paris. Great staff, unbeatable location. Happy despite the blackout.”
Reviews.Author: darrell78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a studio club room (overlooking the river) for 3 nights in the beggining of April with my wife and our 1-year old son. The location is arguably the best in Paris, overloooking the Seine, 2 blocks from Notre Dame, right by the Latin Quarter. Having been to Paris many times, in my opinion, it doesn't get any better than that. The apartment was modern, well lit, pristine, with a large bathroom, a queen size bed, flat screen tv, Ipod player and all necessary amenities, inlcuding a crib for the baby (which was placed at no extra cost) and a state-of-the art kitchinnette (crucial if you travel with a baby). The Quai can get noisy with sirens during the day, though, which can be annoying. For us, the view was well worth it though and at night it's amazing. Breakfast was great, not lavish but just what we needed to start our day. Newspapers were provided, so were high chairs, and service was absolutely amazing thoughout our stay. Staff were corteous, helpful and always there. Note that this is an Apart Hotel and not your typical white glove, room serviced, 5-star hotel. They won't have a bell boy to take your bags and you won't be able to order in. The only problem we had, which was a major pain, was that a 24-hour blackout affected the area of the hotel and we were left with absolutely no power overnight, inlcuding no elevators. The hotel does not have a backup generator, which made us pretty upset, and made our night bwith a jetlagged baby pretty challenging. On a good note (which is why my review of this facility is "excellent"), the staff went out of their way to make our life easier. They were courteous, appologetic, understanding and efficient despite the circumnsances. They waived the charges for the night, payed for a taxi and placed us in a suite in an amazing nearby Citadines facility. I later got an email from the managers appologizing again. Despite a major glitch in the facility (no backup electricity), their customer service is extraordinary. Bottomline, if you're looking for a fancy hotel with room service, marble lobby, valet parking, etc, look somewhere else and be ready to spend over 500 euros/ night. If you're looking for an laid back, reasonably priced, spacious, clean, modern, well-serviced apart hotel this is one of the best choices around.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: tutscruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days in a one bedroom apart. Everything you could want here. Grocery store 2 blocks away, tons of cafe's and shops two blks in any direction. two metro stops, bus and train within 2 blocks.Right on the Seine. Notre Dame, Saint Chappele, the Louvre two blocks away.River cruises right there. The hotel was great, the staff was wonderful, very helpful. spoke english. We were able to check in early. I would return there again and again. free wi-fi-, small kitchen, lg bedrm and living rm. Paris is awesome and this is the place to stay . reasonable also. ask for a rm with a view-off the street our only complaint--maid service needs some better training, and review

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bricari
Reviews.Content: I booked the Citidines St Germaine from the comments on trip advisor and a personal e mail to a reviewer. As a first trip to Paris we were not disappointed. We initially wanted an apartment to cook but found that the abundance of restaurants and the cost saw us dining out every night. The Citidines is in a great location to St Michel, Rue Buci and the Latin Quarter restaurants although the St Michel are more tourist orientated. A quick walk across/along the Seine has you at the Louvre and Notre Dame, Musee D'orsay and also the Marias. It is on the left bank right on the River Seine near the Pont Neuf Bridge.The staff were friendly and helpful and the free coffee/hot chocolate was great after a long day and for us sometimes cold and rainy. For a first timer or a returner I would highly recommend the Citidines St Germaine.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing going for it”
Reviews.Author: macdani
Reviews.Content: The Good: The best thing going for the Citadines St Germain is the location. It's ideally situated on the banks of the Seine, across from the Lourve and eye sight away from the Notre Dame. The staff are also helpful and friendly. The bad: I found the rooms to be a major disappointment. Our room was old and tired, with a lot of damage to walls that had not been fixed, or had been patched up poorly. The bathroom was small, with the shower built into a bulkhead which made it impossible to stand up properly (and I'm only 5'6, my husband is 6'3). The kitchenette was convenient, however given the variety of excellent cafes in St Germain, we did not use it much outside of having breakfast. If the rooms were more nicely presented and maintained better, and taking into consideration how much you pay to stay here, I would give it a better rating. However, in their current state, I can only say that this hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families bang in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: arewethereyetrosie
Reviews.Content: I love Citadines and have been a fan since I discovered them in Brussels a decade ago. Until then I was cooking dinner secretly in hotels with a little electric stove. The kitchen was like a dream and I was hooked. The whole principal of aparthotels is perfect for family travel. The rooms in this hotel may be a little in need of smartening up but the staff are really kind and friendly. They were keen to help suggesting restaurants and supermarkets. The location is unbeatable. We had a very quiet room with a courtyard view but the more expensive rooms at the front have views across the Seine to the Ile de la Cite. Some rooms are huge and excellent if you are looking for somewhere to stay for some weeks. If like me you are wedded to your car, the big bonus is the private parking.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pacacc
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Neither my wife nor I spoke a word of French and the staff was multilingual and very accommodating. The room was well appointed and very clean. It also offered free wi-fi which was a pleasant surprise. The location was very convenient to the Metro. There were shops and restaurants right around the corner which we enjoyed. The bed was a little too hard for our liking. Otherwise, the place was great and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Varshee
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the front door of the hotel we were in love with Paris. This hotel had ALOT to do with it. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon in Feb. We had asked for a higher floor room with nice views and when we walked into the room, we jumped up for joy as that is exactly what we got. The view from our room was over River Seine, the Louvre and Notre Dame, just gorgeous. They even had a note from the front desk wishing us a pleasant honeymoon and a bottle of Tattinger champagne to enjoy. The front desk was very helpful, really lovely. The hotel is well equipped, the room is self contained with fridge, microwave, heated towel racks etc and sooo comfortable. The hotel is very central, there are millions of resturants, cafes and bars close by and the metro is just across the road. I would definitely stay here again, infact I want to plan my next trip to Paris already!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Katka31
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to decide on the hotel to stay in Paris, but I believe it was the best decision. This hotel got the best location, walking distance to major attractions. Apartment was fine,well equiped kitchen,nice bathroom,roomy and clean, only negative I can think of was airconditioning. It was not working properly. Room was very cold, receptionist came up to have a look, but said this part of the hotel is colder that the rest of it. It would have been fine if it was in summer months, but December temperatures call for some good heating system..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: livresse
Reviews.Content: The apartment overlooks River Seine and is within walking distance to Notre-Dame and Louvre, and is exactly next to Pont Neuf. I really loved this charming little place. St Germaine has lots of wonderful and inexpensive eating, especially near St Michel station. You can just walk across the street to the Metrostation at Pont neuf and take a train to Galleries Lafayette (only 3-4 stations away)! The lobby is welcoming and inviting, makes you want to linger there upon arrival. The staff at the counter is great, able to give very good recommendations on where to eat and help you make reservations if your french is not the fluent. We saw lots of Japanese tourists during our stay - obviously a hotspot for them. The room has a little kitchenette and the Residence Manager left a instant noodle packages for us which was very touching because it was a 'touch of home' in a foreign city. Kitchenette had kettle, fridge, dishwasher, cooker and everything you need to make a meal. Feels much better than living in a hotel. Bathroom is great- large mirror with lots of storage. Laundromat is available. The room is charming. TV is a little small for the size of room, but otherwise everything is fine. If you get one of the river-facing rooms, the view is FANTASIC. In all, I would say that it's a charming, homely and welcoming place ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gilgang
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Citadines wad great, the quality of the accommodation, location and helpful staff. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: vicnot
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two separate occasions, the first in a Seine-view room (take this option) and the second on the side street (a bit noisy in the morning). The location was fantastic, just over the river to the Louvre and Tuileries, upriver a few blocks to Notre Dame and the Hotel de Ville (gorgeous ice skating), or back into the streets of St Germain des Pres. The breakfast was cheap and satisfactory, and offered more options than most cafes nearby. The staff were helpful and booked great transfers for our (large) group. The Wifi was a bit intermittent but only a minor gripe. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jvdv
Reviews.Content: Great location to stay, right in THE middle of Paris. The hotel itself is ok. Price versus is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: searcher33
Reviews.Content: My wife,17year old son and I stayed here for 4 nights.We arrived at Gare du Nord railway station on the Eurostar train and then caught a Metro train to St.Michel station.It was then only a short walk to Citadines and we pulled our suitcases on wheels behind us on the footpath(sidewalk). The desk staff at Citadines allowed us to check into our appartment straight away even though we arrived a long time before the official check in time.The staff spoke English. Our 2 bedroom appartment was very spacious .It was very quiet day and night. WiFi internet was free.We walked to a Carrefour supermarket and bought fresh and reheatable food for breakfast and dinners.We heated food in the oven and washed the crockery and cutlery in the dishwasher.The free hot beverages in the foyer were great. The beds and pillows were comfortable and we slept well.The location next to the river was excellent because we were able to walk to cafes, shops,restaurants,tourist attractions and the train station.When we checked out, the staff stored our suitcases in the luggage room until we were ready to leave Paris. This is an excellent appartment hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in St. Germain and a Great Price--I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Citadines hotels for their comfort and their pricing, and usually their well chosen location,and the Citadines Saint Germain des Pres proved to be no exception. As you will have read in countless reviews, the location is superb---directly on the Seine between Notre Dame (only blocks away) and the Louvre, with all the great restaurants and shops of St. Germain directly behind you. Having stayed in Paris perhaps 40 times, I would say that this hotel---dollar for dollar/value/comfort and location in St. Germain make staying here a no brainer. I got a discount rate of 115 Euros per night for a studio room with a very comfortable pull out bed---but the room---was extremely large, much larger than rooms I have payed much more for and included a good size kitchen and nice sized bathroom. The lobby is very tastefully decorated, and the continental breakfast (although lacking meats) was a fine value for 10 Euro. I would stay here again in a second---and undoubtedly will. I wish I had discovered it before. When I checked in, the very kind man behind the counter at first told me that he wouldn't have a room available for a few hours (as it was only noon), but when I explained that I had just traveled in from Los Angeles, he went out of his way to get a room ready for me immediately. Bottom line---you can't go wrong at this price and in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: reissu-erkki01
Reviews.Content: Quiet , clean (appartment) hotel in the city center with very spacy rooms and with cooking facilities. Good petit dejeuner included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes but falls down on the details”
Reviews.Author: AOliverCambridge
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Citadines Saint-Germain-des-Pres in October 2010. The location and front desk staff are fantastic. The rooms are also excellent and the well-appointed kitchen was much appreciated. However the devil is in the details: 1. my two-year old could unlock the front door of our apartment, open it and run down the hotel hallway! I ended up needing to barricade the front door. 2. the bedroom door wouldn't close because the bed/headboard/side tables (an all-in-one unit) is in the wrong spot. 3. there was no shampoo and conditioner, which I especially needed it on this trip because I'd "packed light". 4. likewise no coffee and tea 5. you were required to empty your own bins and oftentimes make your own bed. It would be handy for the hotel to add a few more euros to the price and provide basic toiletries, tea, coffee, sugar and cooking oil. While the nearby supermarket had such things in stock and the front desk can provide some items for a small fee, I often wondered 'why can't it just be in the rooms?'. Such details gave the impression the hotel was being unnecessarily frugal; especially on top of their do-it-yourself cleaning policy. Also I didn't want to be put in the position of needing to take basic groceries home (and through international customs). As I said, these are all small details, and nothing which couldn't be overcome. But it did detract from an otherwise fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, efficient, walk to everything. Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Laarne
Reviews.Content: We loved the Citadine. It is a hotel without Parisian charm but it is modern, clean, comfortable, well located and efficiently staffed. We stayed with our two children for 4 days in early-July 2010. Our room overlooked the Seine and Pont Neuf and you could see Sacre Coure and Notre Dame. We walked across the Pont Neuf to the Louvre and Ile de la Cite and Ile St. Louis (Notre Dame, St. Chapelle). It is about 4 long blocks from the St. Michel Metro to the hotel. The room had a separate bedroom with its own television and a living room with fold-out sofa bed, chairs, desk, hospital-style moveable narrow table and mini-kitchen with all amenities. The kitchen has a stove, pots, mini-dishwasher, junior refrigerator, dishes, microwaveâ€¦everything youâ€™ll need. We never ate the over-priced breakfast at the hotel. My husband ran out to the shops, bakeries, etc. behind the hotel each morning to get breakfast pastries and breads. Go to the very affordable Carrefour in St. Germain for food and drinks but donâ€™t dawdle. It closes at 6pm on Sunday and isnâ€™t open on Monday. We made eggs for breakfast and sandwiches for to carry with us for lunch. Buy bottles of water at the Carrefour and refill them where you can. Thereâ€™s a cold water cooler in the Lobby that we hit several times a day. There are tons of restaurants and cafes behind the hotel to eat dinner. The only English-speaking channel the hotel gets is the BBC. The computers in the lobby with free Internet were in constant use. When you leave, if youâ€™re going to De Gaulle be sure to arrange for a cab at least 24 hours in advance. The desk will arrange it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time in Paris at the Citadines Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: aquarianna
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 glorious days in Paris. Part of what made our vacation so great was the stay at this Citadines, located right on the Seine across from Ile de la Cite. The St-Michel Metro is about 1 one block away - we took the RER B train direct from the airport to this stop which was a great deal at only about 9 euros/person. We had a 1-bedroom suite. It was very large, clean and modern. Our room faced an inner courtyard so even though we had no view of the city it was very quiet at night. The kitchenette has everything you need if you want to cook your own meals. The Citadines model does not provide daily housekeeping, which was fine for us. There were plenty of clean towels - and a nice heated towel rack in the bathroom. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and accommodating - everyone spoke English. We walked almost everywhere from this central location - it borders on the Latin Quarter so at night there was a lot of buzz from the students and bars in the area, and you could still find some wonderful restaurants, cafes and shopping close by. We felt very safe at all times of the day and night. In particular, I recommend these restaurants, both on rue Dauphine, about a 5 min. walk from the hotel (unfortunately not French food): Pizza Marinara - run by a family from Napoli and the best Italian food you'll find outside of Italy. Also great prices, compared to other French restaurant menus. And Fajitas - owned by an American/Mexican couple and great, authentic Mexican food with generous portions. We will definitely stay at this Citadines again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: wakefieldfamily
Reviews.Content: This apartment is in a fantastic location. Walking distance to major sites, although very long walk to Eiffel Tower. We did it with 5 children but we took the train back. Great shops, restaurants and all that Paris has to offer abounds outside the doorstep. Apartment is clean, but you do not have a change of linen. Washer dryer available in basement. Internet by cable in apartment and wireless in lobby. This is the only ugrade that would be very helpful so that smartphones can be used in the apartment. Also, our unit was very warm upon arrival so air conditioning needs to be turned on to a comfortable level prior to guest arrival. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart building, friendly staff, unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: jenniepomme
Reviews.Content: As has been said before the location of this place really is so perfect, equidistant between the Louvres and Notre Dame and both only about ten mins walk. The building has a smart lobby with free hot drinks all day (my children loved being able to help themselves to hot chocolate whenever they liked) and free wi fi which I could receive from the bedroom and was quick and easy to use. The rooms were spacious, smart and clean, the kitchen functional, no cooker but a hob, microwave and fridge were useful and meant we could make our own meals occasionally and save some money (the breakfast here at 10 Euros is quite pricey for a help-yourself buffet). The room was extremely quiet, I didn't hear other guests unless they walked past the door and the only street noise was the occasional siren and the bin lorry at 7am every morning. I must warn you that the entrance to the parking is extremely tight. We have a wide car and unfortunately clipped the bumper on a bollard trying to get in - v.difficult to manouevre and not the best way to arrive! Staff were friendly and helpful providing us with maps pointing out the local supermarket, bank, boulangerie etc and went out of their way to help when we asked for it. The local metro was closed for a refurb when we were there and the bateau mouche v.expensive so we walked everywhere, even to the Eiffel Tower - a lovely river walk that was a long way but it meant we saw so much more and the kids slept well that night! I'm already planning my next trip back and can't imagine finding a better location than here, we'll bring a smaller car next time though, or maybe try Eurostar!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: RaglandTTiger
Reviews.Content: Came here with my wife and two adult children. We got a large apartment rather than a regular one because the latter were booked up and we really wanted to stay at this place. It was even larger than we expected. The kitchen was well appointed, the living room and bedroom were spacious (especially the living room). Two twin beds pulled out from the sofa, which is much nicer than those fold out mattresses that lose their even firmness right away. Both the twin and the queen beds were very comfortable, along with the rest of the furniture. Our room was very quiet, which is remarkable given that the front of the hotel is on a very busy road. The only noise we heard in our 5-day stay was when the garbage truck came by one morning. As has been noted by others, the location is absolutely unbeatable. So for five days we lived in a lovely apartment in some of the prime residential real estate in all the world. It made for a wonderful vacation, if not a cheap one. My only warning is this: if you are coming to Paris to watch television or surf the web, you might be surprised that the flat screen tv's in the room are a bit on the small side. Internet service can only be had in the lobby and the three computers there were very, very slow. Otherwise, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sayeed2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with full satisfaction, very convenient location, extremely helpful front desk, good amenities. Rooms are spacious but no room service.Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Perrett1984
Reviews.Content: I travelled with friends to Paris for a girls weekend and I booked Citadines Saint-Germain-des-Pres as the hotel looked really nice and seemed to be very good value. As there were 5 of us, we ideally wanted a room we could all share so we didnt have one person on there own. The room was quite small for 5 of us but really was good value, very clean and perfect location. The hotel is on the river right by the Notre Dame. What made this hotel even more perfect was the area. Very safe, lots of nice resturants and bars in easy walking distance and friendly helpful staff. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's all”
Reviews.Author: BondiBaz
Reviews.Content: June 2010 - stayed in a one bed apartment (top floor) really small and built in to the roof, very hot. Air con didn't seem to have any guts and calls to reception to fix it were ignored. Had to sleep with the windows open due to the summer heat and the road below is noisy, although the view from the window was very good. Much cheaper hotels have coffee making facilities in the room, and even though this one had a small kitchenette you had to go down to street level reception for a coffee, not very good. The reception staff were slow check in/out queing for 30 mins , don't try getting in to the car park with anything bigger than a VW Golf as it is tiny and difficult to get in to. I would expect a lot more than this for the 320 euro per night price tag. It could be better with some improved services.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: steven044
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Citadines St. Germain based on the reviews from Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. I was tempted to pick another Citadines at a lower price (the Citadines reservations staff also offered other locations at better pricing), but this location was perfect for our purposes - which was to be located centrally, near some sights (Notre Dame and Louvre are easily walkable), and access to food stands and restaurants. I traveled with my wife and three children from 8 to 12 years old in this intro to Europe trip for them. Located right across from Ile de la Cite and a few minutes from active cafe area though touristy Boulevard St. Michel and a more local cafe and restaurant area in the opposite direction from the hotel, this was a great spot to base out of to visit Paris. Nearest Metro is just a block or so away and with the St. Germain area restaurants nearby, and a grocery store, combined with the kitchenette at this family room for 4 plus additional cot, a convenient laundry on site, we were very pleased. We did not opt for the 15 Euro per person breakfast at hotel but purchased our bread and cheese, fruits and juices at the nearby grocery store which was indicated on the map handed out by the staff, and spent 20Euro's total for a much more complete breakfast for 5. We had some miscommunication regarding the room cleaning service - which came at an extra price - and despite repeated attempts to have the basic cleanup performed, it was only actually done only one day of our 4 night stay. This was inconvenient only since we were expecting towels to be washed and beds made, but ok, as it isn't hard to hang your own towels and with 3 young children we are used to putting together our own beds. On this issue the manager was apologetic and seemed sincere and offered our family free breakfast on our final day - something we hadn't asked for, but was convenient on the day we packed out. In the end, we stayed 4 nights and found this location to be extremely convenient, the rooms clean and spacious, kitchenette ample, and the staff was pleasant and helpful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for family tourists”
Reviews.Author: VaidyanathanSuresh
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for performing in Theatre de la Ville Paris on Jun 12th. It was a prestigious occasion. The organizers have booked me in Citadines St Germain. I was given a double cot room for a single occupancy in view of my music instruments baggage. Quite roomy, compact and the view from the windows was romantic. it is close to the big canal and best suited for strolls. A 24 hr free coffee machine, free internet at the lobby were my favorites. The 10 Euro breakfast was very filling and tasty. I loved the stay and planning to go with family to Paris for vacation shortly and would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Class and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2429
Reviews.Content: Our first and very favorable experience with the Ascot Group's Citadines Apart-hotel chain. We took the Eurostar from London to Gare du Nord and a 15 minute ride on the B RER (St. Michel stop) to the hotel 5 minutes away from the quay exit. The hotel foyer was bright and airy with a keyed entrance. Staff were friendly, polite and efficient. After a day out, we requested for a voltage adapter and forgot to leave our name and room number. The attentive staff still managed to book one for us and sent it up the next morning. Breakfast was large, fresh and very good (don't miss the pain du chocolat) and there was a free of charge 24 hr beverage machine. Everything was well stocked and clean. Location has Paris at your feet: public bus 69 to the Eiffel and Musee D'Orsay (walkable), walk to Notre Dame, Sorbonne and the Louvre. For afternoon tea lovers, walk 2 blocks down Rue des Grands Augustins (5 mins) to Mariage Freres. Citadines St. Germain-des-Pres is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around - Even Better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ozadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 years earlier & I think our stay this time was even better! The position is brilliant. Hundreds of fantastic (and reasonably priced) restaurants within a 5 minute amble down the street. Wander up the road to the Louvre & Musee D'Orsay and other direction to Notre Dame. On/Off bus stops very close, Metro around corner. Breakfast is good value. Staff were even better this time! Nothing to criticise! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ohwheretonext
Reviews.Content: 4 girls (ok women!) 3 nights in a 4 bedded apt. Location perfect, reception area modern, clean and airy. Free tea/coffee machine, internet access and luggage storage in reception. Room 1123 slept 4 with a double bedroom and twin pull out sofa type beds in living area. Shower room and separate loo - only minor criticism was no washbasin in loo. Kettle, microwave, dishwasher (not that we used them), 2 TVs and CD player. Of note, no change of towels if staying less than 4 nights but you can pay 8 euros per day to change them! Breakfast is extra at 10 euros however we used the choice of patisseries just round the corner up Rue Dauphine. We could not have wished for a better location and didn't use public transport at all apart from arriving and leaving! Would definitely stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not romantic but worth the small issues”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: I think some of the more recent reviews have said it all. Whether to stay here depends so much on what you are looking for in Paris. On the plus side, it is in a fantastic location, The 24 hour front desk can be helpful with arrivals and departures, calling cabs, getting directions etc (compared to the option of renting a nicer apartment from an agent..) The staff are fine, although more there to answer specific questions than volunteer things --they always seem pretty busy. It is reasonably priced for what you get, all day tea coffee, papers etc downstairs is nice as is the option for washing etc. There is outside noise, but that seems to us to be par for the course in Paris!? There is a functioning kitchen with a fridge and space to eat meals at a table. Much better than a hotel room for any length of stay we think. But you are giving up the benefits of a plusher hotel -- the studios just have a pull out sofa bed, which is pretty uncomfortable but ok, the furniture is a little tired, but again ok, and there is a bit of noise between rooms. There are all that you need nearby as far as shops, restaurants etc go, (although the closest supermarket we thought was slow, surly and at one stage seemed to delight in letting us stand in the wrong line until we reached the end before directing us elsewhere! But one disappointing shop didnt affect a great neighbourhood) We had another single night later in Paris and picked a nice hotel for that night, but for a few days with the family, we thought that this was the right balance!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: monchotico
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, great big confortable rooms, perfect breakfast
