Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and nice room”
Reviews.Author: tkSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I had been in Paris with my children, and had a great time. The rooms are big, with a god decoration, and has a small kitchen, that is very useful to heat a milk or to open bottle of wine. The hotel is just in front of Notre Dame and beside a lot of nice restaurants, and subways stations. The only thing is the hotel is a apart hotel, that means the cleaning of the room is extra charge, but worth while. I will back there for sure several time's. Taiza

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for self catering in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: libertysurf
Reviews.Content: Just returned. Excellent location. Lovely staff. Free coffees. Clean. But, sleep was hard to come by in room 1112. Directly over the road to the car park and where the bins are. Very cold since nothing underneathe. Very noisy. Dark windows because of design of gate to car park. Expedia rate v good. Â£345 for 3 adults one child for 2 nights. Would go again, but not in this room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: sofresh21983
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here when we got engaged over the New Year and had a great time. The hotel is really clean, the staff is very approachable, the location was perfect but it did lack a bit of romance that you'd come to expect from a stay in Paris. As a start and stop point for the day it was great and extremely central. It just lacked that charm we were hoping for. All that being said, I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and highly functional, but lacks romance”
Reviews.Author: nvintage
Reviews.Content: As everyone says the location is spot on situated between Pont Neuf and St Michel metro stations and the hotel/apartment complex has a feeling of a home away from home, with there being a 24 hr front desk. We stayed in a studio apartment and slept on a pull out/sofa bed, which was quite uncomfortable, but given you get a kitchen also, I guess this is the price you pay. We had a room situated on the opposite side of the building to the Seine and there was quite a lot of noise from the courtyard the window faces during the night. Internally there also seemed to be a lack of insulation, you could hear neighbouring rooms and we were woken early morning both nights. St-Germain is a great and lively area with lots of places to eat and bars around. Based on our studio stay, I would recommend this apart/hotel for business, or longer stays but wouldn't recommend it for romantic escapes or for short stays as I think there are more comfortable options.

Reviews.Title: “Right where we needed to be”
Reviews.Author: sprankos
Reviews.Content: A great apartment with so much room. The room was very clean. Four adults shared this apartment.. We stayed 6 nights and would have liked at least one or two changes of towels in that time. The staff were always very professional, pleasant and extremely helpful. the hotel was a peaceful haven after a log day sightseeing. We loved that the hotel was so close to many attractions, across the road from the Seine, down the little back strreets were fantastic little cafes. We could soak up all things French.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, great rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tandjadventures
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for 6 nights in a large 1 bedroom apartment that we booked directly on the citadines website. the size of the apartment was fantastic and the location was close to all the majors - across the road from the Lourve, 500 metres from Notre Dame, and we walked to all of the other sites including the eiffel tower. the metro station is close - st michel notre dame. the staff were very helpful any time of the day or night. the room was large and the fold out bed was amazing for two people. we had plenty of space for hanging clothes and for two couples it was not at all intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: spankyshorts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the 6th arrondisement, I believe, and is right on the Seine river. Perfect central location 5 minute walk to Notre Dame-St. Michel metro station. Couture shopping is right outside your door. Notre Dame 10 minute walk. Louvre 10 minute walk. Everything central is just right outside your door. You won't be disappointed at all. And for the price in central Paris for a relatively fancy hotel, it can't be beat. The breakfast in the morning is quite good, nothing spectacular but you get good value. The concierge and hotel staff were all friendly. The room is small however you are in central Paris so it was actually quite large with a kitchenette. The gym is quite small in the hotel so I would recommend going for a morning run instead of working out inside the hotel. Afterall you are in Paris and why not run outside and explore at the same time. Excellent hotel to stay at for a few days to several weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: AAAmericanflyer
Reviews.Content: As a hotel/apartment it is a different type of property. Location at St Michael metro in the 6th district. The location is perfect for a traveller who wants to see all the major Paris sites. The kitchen had all the basic items needed to prepare a meal. A grocery store and outdoor food stalls are within in a 5 minute walk. The staff spoke excellent English and was very helpful with any questions. In room internet works very well and the hotel has 3 computers available in the lobby. We booked a studio and its use as a base for touring was fantastic. If you want to lounge in the room its simple but functional furniture may not be the best choice. TV channels selection geared to French speakers. Room has CD player. Room cleaning service comes only on your seventh day of your stay. Earlier room service or towel change result in an extra fee. We did not try the small breakfast buffet in the lobby. We elected to go the the many cafes in the area instead. This well always be our hotel for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice for paris”
Reviews.Author: ozzietraveller09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment with our 15 year old son for two separate weeks in July - loved it so much the first time that we canceled our second week's booking elsewhere and returned to the Citadines! Both times we checked in quite early in the morning after long haul flights and were immediately given access to the apartment. Our two bedroom apartment was large by Aussie standards. We always felt we had plenty of room for luggage - including a bike in a bike box. The location is just as superb as other travellers have said - we walked and used the no. 24 bus which is right outside. On one day when we felt lazy we took a one day pass on a hop on, hop off bus , which again travels right past the door. We spent many happy hours just wandering the nearby streets in St Germain des Pres, great food shops and even a little supermarket a few minutes walk away. Our room was quiet and comfy, excellent Internet access at all times. The staff were pleasant and helpful with little things such as additional towels and dishwasher powder. There is a small gym room, always free for our son to access. We would not stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Went there with girlfriend for suprise getaway and was pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: pympster
Reviews.Content: The room was much bigger than I expected, we had a murphy bed (meaning it folds up into the wall as in the james bond film!) The kitchen was very good and had all the utensils we needed. The location is great, 10 minute walk from notre dame and many velib stations around!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: delucafam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in mid August. Hotel was just a half block from the Pont du Neuf Bridge. You are about a 10 minute walk from the Louvre in one direction, a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame in the other and 5 minutes to Saint Germain. The hotel itself was very clean and quiet (our room was in the rear away from the street). All of the staff were extremely helpful and curteous. There was free coffee and internet in the lobby. As for the coffee, never had any better!! The machine had fresh coffee beans and you could get 4/5 types of coffee. Great savings over the time we were there given the cost of a cup in the cafes. The room itself was quite large and comfortable, plenty of closet space and full kitchen. Only the air conditioning had to be turned to a very low temperature to get to where we are used to in the States. Area was very safe and hotel was easy to find after a day of sightseeing, given its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: clebl095
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The Seine is in across the street. The rooms are great, the staff absolutely wonderfull. Close to the Louvres, Notre-Dame and les Jardins du Luxembourg. Great cafÃ©s close by. Shopping all around. Near a subway and train station. I had a wonderfull time. Our opened on a small and quiet courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip with 3 teens”
Reviews.Author: HelloTina
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris early. There was a clean apt available so we were able to check in early and catch a quick nap before exploring. The suite was small but clean and modern with a kitchenette, master bedroom, bathroom. The kids had a day bed that turned into a trundle and we got another cot. We had a gardenview room. Even though the rooms were small, we did not come to Paris to sit in our rooms!. Everything was so close. Sunset was after 10pm. There were bands on street corners performing all evening. It was a great trip and this apt/hotel was such a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: raysse
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it felt more like a hotel then an apartment. The kitchenette was really tiny but well stocked. The rooms aren't big and I wouldn't have liked to be staying in the studio apartment with a toddler. Not much room to play. The location is very easy - you can walk to the Louvre, d'Orsay, Pompidou, Musee Rodin, Musee Picasso, Luxembourg gardens and lots more, I won't go though the whole list. If you prefer to use public transport there's lots of buses and trains nearby, we used the 24 and 27 quite a bit, the small streets behind the hotel were good for deli food to heat in your room and there were lots of places to eat, boulanger, patisseries etc. Staying right across from the river adds an unbeatable atmosphere to your time in Paris. The staff were really helpful. I've stayed overlooking a side lane and a courtyard, both rooms were fine. It's extremely clean with firm comfortable beds and good lighting. The breakfast was very simple but good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: The last several times we stayed on the outskirts of Paris and traveled in. This time, we wanted to stay right in the center of everything and it is definitely worth it especially since we want to hit all the attractions in only a few days. Everytthing is within walking distance. The RER station is only a short walk away down the block. The staff is excellent and very helpful with most speaking good English and no snobbiness you get with some of the French wait staff. We were helped by a guy named Heddy who was really great. There is coffee and a water cooler for guests and a paid breakfast if you want but there are plenty of bakeries nearby that it makes it worth your while to eat out. The room has comfortable linen, free internet access, clean bathroom, and a cozy atmosphere overall. There is valet parking if you need and 3 computers in the lobby for your use. They also have a room for luggages for those who are early or late catching a plane. Overall it was a great stay with us being able to return to rest before heading out for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location - ideal for holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Akhkam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with my 9 year old and 5 year old. It isgreat location- 2 mins walk from Pont Neuf so easy to get to the Louvre or Notre Dame. On the Metro line 4 so direct access from Gare du Nord (we did the Eurostar) and to Sacre Coeur. Also on the RER C so direct to the Eiffel Tower as well. Amenities are good - free high speed internet access from the computers in the lobby or from our own laptop in the room and free hot drinks from a coffee machine in the lobby. Breakfast available - looked good value but we walked to some local Cafe's at St Michel for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in fab location”
Reviews.Author: scruffymonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Citadines in February with a group of friends for my hen do and highly recommend it. The apartments were lovely and clean and we found the kitchen more than adequate for preparing breakfast. We loved the complimentary coffee and hot chocolate in the foyer area and the staff were very helpful. We couldn't fault the location, close to many metro stops and you are right on the River Seine (helps with navigation!), a short walk from the Louvre and the Notre Dame, and close to loads of restaurants and bars. We particuarly liked Le Pub which is a short walk from apartment - fab cocktails, hot chocolate and great food, bit pricey but the atmosphere and service were worth it (tip there is a cocktail happy hour every day- though still makes it about 7 euros but very nice !!). We tended to walk most places so therefore didn't use up the book of ten metro tickets we used having said that it did save faffing around for change whenever we did use the metro. One of my favourite things about the apartment is that just behind are loads of lovely patisseries, boulangeries and supermarkets, there is also a really reasonably priced wine shop which we frequented- helped keep the costs down on our nights out! This citadines tends to be a bit more than the others but well worth it !! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for Paris, minor complaints.”
Reviews.Author: ZeroTX
Reviews.Content: This is a decent value for Paris, as everything in Paris is overpriced and this hotel is decently priced. They market this as an apartment-hotel, for business people staying in Paris for a few weeks. It does indeed have a kitchetnette with a small stove, microwave oven and refrigerator. However, I would not call this an apartment. In order to make it a sitting room and a bedroom, they use convertible sofa-beds. As you probably know, these are horrendously uncomfortable. As sofa-beds go, these were not the worst, but I'd much rather have just had a real bed and no couch, whether it's a long-term stay or not. The photos are mis-leading and may lead you to believe that the rooms are suites with a sofa AND a bed. They do not. Also, wireless internet only works in the lobby. The room has a WIRED internet connection, for which you need a computer with an RJ-45 ethernet jack on it. Your wireless only devices (such as an iPhone) will only work in the lobby. However, the wired connection works just fine if you have a laptop with you. Parking is expensive, but convenient (18 Euro per day) and you WILL NOT want to drive your car in Paris, because there is literally nowhere to park. Also, confirm that this hotel is near where you want to stay. It is nowhere near the tourist areas. Overall I would recommend this hotel, but I feel they should be very clear about the accommodations. It is a regular sized (small-ish) hotel room with a tiny kitchen. It is not a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: danielaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We are a family with two teenage children and found the Citadines St Germain des Pres to be perfect. It was clean, modern and reasonably spacious. My husband and I shared the bedroom whilst my 19 year old slept on the roll out bed and 15 year old on the sofa bed. We were all quite comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped and clean. There was also plenty of cupboard space. As per previous reviews, location was great being close to many attractions, the metro, restaurants, supermarkets and shops. And yes, the hot chocolate did run out by the afternoon but the cappuccinos flowed all day! Reception staff were very helpful. Will definately return. Also stayed at the Citadines Trafalgar Square in London which was no nowhere near the standard of this Citadines.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Appartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaCanberra
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this great location for four nights in mid January. The place was clean, modern, and very efficiently run. We could not find a single fault. Location was brilliant. The kitchen was properly stocked with all the implements one could ever need, including steak knives - the French take their eating seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mumroange
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the citadines st germaine from Xmas Day to New Years Day. Fantastic location, so close to metro and all the attractions. The local area is packed with little shops, cafes and bakeries...absolutely divine. Our top floor 1 bedroom apt had a fantastic view and was clean and all we needed. Yes, it was small but not as bad as I was expecting. We were promised 2 trundle beds ( as reviewed here and confirmed) in the living room but our boys were not too happy when we discovered that it was indeed a sofa bed they had to share. All was going famously until my husband and sons were stuck in the lift and noone answered their calls on the emergency phone! My 9 year old was very distressed. It took a while to fix ( the lift and our son!) during which time we had to take the stairs to the 7th floor urgh! When the lift was fixed and our son ready to try again....it happened again! The staff were lovely about it but still...not ideal! We had the breakfast, nothing fancy and yes, it could be purchased much more cheaply around the corner. The complimentary coffee all day was fantastic, the hot chocolate did always run out but hey...a free hot coffee when you get back was very handy! A great little hotel and regardless of our lift issues we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “**Loved Citadines**”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaPrettyKitty
Reviews.Content: My wonderful husband booked our trip to Paris as a surprise for my 30th birthday. Our travel agent recommended this hotel to him due to its great location. Notre Dame, Saint Chappelle, D'Orsay and the Louvre are within a quick walking distance to this hotel. There are also several metro stops close by. Without a doubt, the location of this hotel is awesome. Our room was clean and seemed much more spacious than we were warned about here on trip advisor. The hotel staff was really great - we arrived in Paris at 6:30am and even though check in wasn't until 3pm, they had a room waiting for us (and they were completely booked). In the months leading up to the trip, the husband communicated with the hotel staff through email; the staff was more than gracious about recommending restaurants as well as booking reservations for us. The hotel does have a breakfast every morning but it was quite expensive - 12 euro or $16. There are tons of really great cafes nearby for a much cheaper breakfast. In conclusion, when returning to Paris, we will definitely stay at this hotel again. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room - Hello!! We were in Paris!!!! - but our room was oh so comfy and the hospitality of the hotel staff made our trip much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: Rosered30
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful nights at the Citadines St. Germain des Pres in December 2008. The views from the attic- type windows of our one bedroom apartment were fabulous - a very Parisian vista of chimney tops and ornate apartment buildings. The rooms were very clean and modern, with a small yet adequate bathroom and well-equipped kitchen. ( It would be smart of management to provide a dishwasher tablet for each night of a stay though, instead of just one!) We enjoyed browsing in nearby supermarkets and bakeries to pick up cheeses, wine, baguettes, salad ingredients etc. which meant we did not have to eat out every night. The beds were comfortable, although extra pillows would have been appreciated. Our 16 year old daughter found the sofa bed in the living room quite comfortable too. We loved the proximity to the boulevard St. Michel, the Louvre, Notre Dame and the banks of the Seine. It was easy to walk to interesting specialist bookshops near the Sorbonne. We found our whole experience of Paris was much more enjoyable this time as the area was so picturesque and conducive to long walks.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNetty
Reviews.Content: booked a four day stay from 1st jan with travelrepublic. Family of 4 with two 10yos. Short walk from metro though entrance to it near the Seine does not issue tickets. had a one bed apartment on fifth floor. Modern, comfy styling. small but perfectly adequate kitchen. nice bathromm with seperate room for loo. Room looked onto internal quad. Nice and quiet and warm. This is mainly a modern building - no historical elements based on its origins that I could see. Never had breakfast but it looked expensive for what it was - serve yourself with an honesty book. Location very convenient for lots of things and nice to walk along the Seine, even if it was freezing cold. did the usual: notre dame, musee d'orsay, eiffel tower (HUGE queues), bateau mouche ride, the conciergerie etc They only clean the rooms once a week so you never see the room maids. we were given only 1 dishwahser tablet for a 4 night stay - so we acquired some more from the room service trolley we found. Other minor gripes: TV has only 2 english channels and they were bbc news and cnn. drinking chocolate in lobby ran out by mid morning every day and was never restocked bins have to empited by guests into a shute in the corridor concierge a bit clueless about where to eat locally so highly recommended for a family with children

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: snoopy67
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We found the staff friendly and very helpful (english speaking). Apartments are small but clean and modern. Location was great, we walked or took the metro which was less than a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service - definitely would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: HarveyBob
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was a walking distance to Notre Dame, The Louvre and Metro and RER station which gave you easy access to other things (such as Musee d'Orsay and Chateau Versailles). The hotel staff was friendly and spoke English which helped in terms of simple questions. However, I have to say when I asked them about some touristy tihngs to do, they weren't much help. It's apartment hotel which means that you can cook your own food and keep your fridge filled with your own stuff rather than paying the expensive hotel prices. The supermarket and other cool shops are 5 mins walk away. It was even more handy as I took my parents who are picky eaters.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rachelleraasch
Reviews.Content: The Citadines was a great hotel; the location was fabulous! Next to cool restaurants, Seine, Notre Dame and Louvre. The room was really cool--modern and clean. I wish we could have stayed longer at the Citadines.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: AnatomicAlpha
Reviews.Content: Pros: - great convenient location - knowledgable staff - in house laundrette facilities for a fee - free water and coffee - clean rooms Cons: - didn't service our room the whole week, even though had promised to - pricey breakfast - uncomfortable fold out sofabed - noisy environment Fine overall if you get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and experience”
Reviews.Author: shannan319
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Citadines St Germain for 4 nights in October 2008. The apartments are located opposite the Seine River about 50 meters down the road from Pont Neuf. We were in apartment 1609 and had glimpes of Notre Dame Cathedral. The studio apartment was clean and contained a bar fridge (empty), dishwasher, microwave, kettle, telephone, free internet access in the rooms. The TV shows about 12 channels and the only one you will get in english will be CNN. The bathroom has a shower/bath, hairdryer and the usual toiletries. The sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable. The rooms are not cleaned daily. Downstairs in the reception area there are free tea and coffee making facilites and computers with free internet access. Breakfast is available every morning, just write your room number on the sheet in the kitchen areas and serve yourself. The Reception staff speak english fairly well and are friendly and helpful. For food turn left when you head out of the hotel and turn left again at the lights for Pont Neuf. You will find a number of cafes, trattorias, bars etc. Avoid the little deli on the left hand side of the road that does not have prices on stock as the price tends to change depending on how well you speak french. Alternatively, take a right when you leave the hotel and walk down to the Great Canadian Pub. Good food, friendly atmosphere and the staff speak english reasonably well. The apartments are about a10-15 minute walk from the Lourve.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_TravellerX2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Citadines for 6 nights in late April and had a fantastic stay! We had a large studio with a comfortable Queen-sized murphy bed, which we never bothered closing, since the room was large enough. The bathroom was very large, even by North American standards, with bath/shower combo, lots of storage and a towel warmer. The room was well-decorated with modern furnishings including 2 comfortable chairs, a large desk, a flat-screen TV, a stereo and cooking area with brand new appliances. The bonus for us was a very large balcony overlooking an inner courtyard, where we could enjoy a glass of wine. It was a very quiet room - not only because of the courtyard, but we never heard other guests either. The location in Paris could not have been better, on the Seine at Pont Neuf - a few minutes' walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, Quartier Latin and so on... The hotel was clean and the staff were hospitable and helpful. Needless to say, we will stay again and ask for the same style of studio room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well equipped studio.”
Reviews.Author: Jayni
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor I decided to book this for our two night stay before heading off to Italy. Having previously stayed in an apartment in the Marais which required a key collection from an address miles away, I wanted apartment facilities in a hotel environment and this fitted the bill perfectly. The studio is small but perfectly formed (and you have to be the Incredible Hulk to get the sofa bed pulled out). The kitchen is very well equipped, kettle, toaster, microwave, dishwasher etc, plenty of cupboard space for longer stays, iron and board in wardrobe in lobby area. Decent bathroom with bath (heaven!) and shower over. Hairdryer with a nozzle that will actually dry your hair without blowing it all over the place like those public baths type ones. Little desk area with plenty of power points and a cable for free high speed internet access - this was really good as so many places charge. I really enjoyed my stay here and could quite happily have stayed longer, although my husband found the space a little restricted with the sofa bed pulled out. Grat location, just opposite Pont Neuf, around the corner from Place Saint-Michel. We found a great little Italian restaurant on the Rue De L'Hirondelle, and great bars on the Rue Mazarine/Rue De Buci. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Yes Yes Yes”
Reviews.Author: JMLAJOIE
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel,wonderful staff, wonderful city, nice room, nice a/c, the bed are confortable for a sofa bed. nice location all around. more infos about the neighbourhood, you have a laundrymat just before the hotel on the side street,and a few minutes walk a touring guide tour "france tourime". you have a supermarket "champion" on the buci street just behind the hotel (about 5 minutes walk), and you have a boat tour in the river seine on the pont neuf just in front of the hotel. be careful for pickpocket in the metro, i saw one in action in metro st-michel. and ask for the map street at the front desk. will stay there again, have a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris, pas de quoi and regardez!”
Reviews.Author: Vanload_to_Venice
Reviews.Content: Just like Eloise.... We lived in the 6eme a few years back, before children, and were looking for somewhere child friendly to stay - we couldn't have picked a better spot. Our small girls were delighted as the location, on the Quai des Grands Augustins, is just where Eloise stays when she goes to Paris. The rooms are super, with a mini kitchen, and much more modern and luxurious than we were expecting. The studios were spacious, not too different in size from the smaller one bedroom apartments. If you have older children, I would recommend the larger one beds, ask when you reserve. The staff were a further plus, nothing was too much trouble - unusual in Paris! Luckily for us, we hit a couple of days of hot weather, not so fortunately the air con wasn't working... The staff did what they could (including upgrading our room), but we had a rotten nights sleep. A real shame, because otherwise it was perfect. As for the area, just walk around, the best of Paris is on your doorstep. We bought a two day Batobus pass (36 euros for the four of us), but otherwise didn't use any public transport. The Jardins de Luxembourg are a must with small children, take a picnic from Gerard Mulot, fab boulangerie by the Marche de St Germain. If you are staying a few days, or hit poor weather, head to the Cite des Sciences et Industries. It's a very hands on museum, with loads to do for children age 4 - 16. If you are considering a break in Paris with children, do it! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Citadines St Germain, a hotel with the convenience of an apartment, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: MarymurphyIreland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay in Paris .The citadine Saint Germaine was an ideal location for a short break.You really get a feel for Paris and lots of restaurents in the locality and life on the streets.It's very close to NotreDame .It's a few minutes walk to a number of metro stations and also regional train station.If arriving by metro get off at Saint Michel stop and its only a few minutes walk from there.The apartment was one bedded ,very well equipped and clean and bright.Staff very helpful and give you a local map with exactly what you need marked eg shop,supermarket,bank ect. Nice reception area to sit in with TV and Internet and coffee complimentary available. Everything was so near it was brillant and you could walk most places or use metro. the air conditioning was working 'slowly' but we hadn't very hot weather anyway so it was ok. They only clean the apartment once a week unless you request it at a cost.This was fine with us as they left us lots of towels .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: taffyeti
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 27th July for my wife's 40th birthday. Initial problem with our reservation requirement supplied by the agency we booked through& whereby we had been allocated a studio rather than an apartment. Desk staff were great in resolving the problem and we found ourself in a very spacious & well equipped apartment.Couldn't fault this accomodation at all in terms of location, size and comfort. We did not sample the breakfast offered by the hotel as we usually picked up croissants and baguettes from a nearby shop and then made use of the FREE tea & coffee machines in the foyer which made lovely beverages. We would definitely stay here again,probably this autumn when the bulk of tourist crowds should have diminished.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great set up for a family!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaStLouis_MO_USA
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel! I had reviewed all of the comments on trip advisor before booking, and everyone's recommendations were right on. One thing I would also add is that when they say sofa bed, they really mean a twin bed and trundle twin bed that comes out. that was great because our two teenagers would not have been comfortable with the traditional pull out with the bar in the middle of the mattress. We also ordered an extra bed for our 10 year old which was equally comfortable. My husband and i had the bedroom. Plenty of space for a family of five - including teenagers. The kitchen set up was great and I was able to make some tasty French breakfast from the grocery store down Rue Dauphine. Air conditioning was great! the decor was beautiful. We didn't have a room with a view, but frankly, we were out of the room enjoying the views of Paris the whole 5 days anyway. Also, consider that if you ask for a room with a view, you are also asking for a window that is fronting an extremely busy, loud, and traffic laden street. It was nice to have the quiet of a side street with no view. I highly recommend this hotel, in particular for families with children or teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place for a family with lots of needs....”
Reviews.Author: Skidge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my brother's 40th Birthday in March. As my father has to walk with a stick and he and Mum probably wanted to go to bed earlier, the self catering option was brilliant. The hotel staff were friendly, the rooms clean and well equipped. We had 2 1 bed apartments, and the sofa beds were used in each as well. The beds all round were comfortable. The only slight criticism is that the bathroom was a little cramped and for parents that are a little slower in life, it may have been a tiny bit awkward, bit didn't detract from the quality. The location was great, and everything was accessible from the apartments. Even the taxi driver who tooks us from Gard du Nord said they were a great place. The hotel staff organised taxis for us and stored our luggage on check out day. The internet facilities and free tea/coffee was also a bonus in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: niagaragal01
Reviews.Content: Our stay was July 2nd to 6th/08 and we were quite surprised by how wonderful everything was. We stayed in a studio apt. #1316 which unfortunately didn't overlook the Seine, but the apt. was very clean, well stocked with two comfortable single beds. I found the front desk staff polite, but I was very impressed with their concierge - he was just wonderful. I was unfortunately pick pocketed at the Pont Neuf (beware of them - they are everywhere) and the concierge certainly went beyond the call of duty helping me with phone numbers and dialed some of the numbers himself and gave me directions to the police station and embassy, he was very concerned, and I just can't say enough on how comforting it was to have his help as I don't speak French. Another wonderful perk was their computers in the lobby - there were 3 of them and it was great to do research and keep in touch with friends. We really didn't have to wait for the computers - there always seemed to be one that was free - plus they also had a printer which was of great help - all free. In the lobby they also had a coffee machine and it also made cappacino and hot chocolate - we found that was a great money saver. I must add that the apartment had a well stocked galley kitchen and eveything was clean. There was a dish washer, stove top, microwave and a small fridge. We bought groceries and the apt. is spacious enough to eat a meal in - after a long day of sight seeing - we did stay in one evening and had all this wonderful gourmet take out and a nice bottle of wine. The TV was a good flat screen and we were able to watch CNN every evening before going to bed. Also as everyone else has stated - it is in a wonderful location close to everything - some great restaurants within minutes - we had a lovely meal at a Guy Savoy restaurant just a couple of doors down - it was called Les Bouquistes - they probably had the best polenta (served with lamb) that I have ever had and my appetizer was a lobster ravioli that was perfect - it was a lovely meal. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and room”
Reviews.Author: pasdedeux94
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day stay, and couldn't be more pleased with the cleanliness and location of this hotel. The bed was a pull out couch, and the mattress , though firm was comfortable. The room, as well as the bathroom appeared newly renovated, and even though the weather was quite hot the a/c worked well. Plenty of hot water, though the pressure was low and the control a little awkward. They could provide extra toilet paper. We had to grab a few rolls of the trolley ourselves. Breakfasts were expensive, but adequate in quantity. There are so many places to eat nearby but we just found it a convenient start to the day. Front staff were pleasant and helpful calling for taxis. The location is superb, we could see a bit of the Seine from our room and is in close walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, Latin Quarter, Luxembourg gardens. Despite the traffic, the room was quiet when window closed. Overall, exeeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the bed a bit uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gurion
Reviews.Content: I booked a large apartment through the Sun Hotels website, for our long family weekend in april. For our kids, 10 and 12 years old, it was the first visit to Paris. I had read a lot about this hotel on TripAdvisor, and the view is often mentioned. I wrote a mail to the hotel two months in advance, and asked for a room with a Seine view. We got the answer that they would do their best. When we arrived we got the opposite, an apartment on the entrance floor facing the atrium garden and the reception windows. It turned out the rate we got at the Sun Hotels web site didn't include luxury like a Seine view. Nothing to do about it then, nothing else avaialble. The apartement itself was clean and well equipped. A towel dryer in the bathroom both kept the bathroom warm, and made the one set of towels we got last for a couple of days. It was a cold weekend, and we got extra blankets from the reception. We needed to buy som winter clothes from the clothing shops nearby, and they were very helpful getting out scarfs and sweathers from the rooms in the back. The spring collections they were selling couldn't help us. But the heating system in the apartement worked well and was easy to adjust. The beds were a little hard and uncomfortable, both in the double bed room and the sofa bed in the living room. Next time I will book from a web site that gives more detailed booking opportunities. The different amenities to choose from does not always become visible on large hotel booking websites. The view would have been worth some extra Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Hotel overbooks and moves you to old, musty hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eacsmum
Reviews.Content: We booked, paid for 2 large apartments for a 2 night stay here March 23, 2008. I had stayed previously in November. The location is great and the hotel is new and clean. I had read several negative reviews about the unhelpful, disinterested staff, and about the hotel overbooking and saying they are "fully booked" when you arrive. However, we decided to risk it do to cleanliness and great location. November's stay was uneventful. When we arrived in May, however, they said "oh, we are very sorry, but, how do you say--we are fully booked." So after a 2 hour stand off in the lobby (during which time we learn from other travelers and a certain compassionate staff member at the hotel, that they do this all the time!) We eventually agreed to be moved to the CItadines about 3/4 mile away- way, way behind the Louvre...do't let them fool you with the promise of its great location. This ancient Citadines was old, musty, smelled of smoke, carpet stained and of course, on a much cheaper price scale. We had already paid for our apartments through Expedia, and Citadines "promised" to contact Expedia about refunding us one night stay. BUt, of couse, we will be SHOCKED if that were to really happen. We were so disappointed as we had others we were meeting up with over the weekend (long, long distance relatives). They had booked all their rooms around the corner from the original Citadines. BUt now we were quite far apart. (small children were involved!) DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU! THey overbook on purpose as they have contracts with the airlines and take care of them first....then decide who to bump. I had read several reviews such as mine. But, they have been taken down from this sight. BEWARE!

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Prestige Saint-Germain-des-Pres
HotelInfo.Address: 53, ter Quai des Grands Augustins, 75006 Paris, France
